initial_question.title: Can the http2 frame content include a stream id field?
initial_question.body:
Hello, I observed that in the current http2 protocol content, headers frame and data frame do not have stream id field, which makes it difficult to match the http2request and http2response of the same stream. Is there a way to add a stream id field to the output of header frames and data frames? 
In addition, the data frame is output of several frames together, can we add an interval between the output of each data frame? 

Here are some of the http2 packets that I captured myself
```
{"time":"2025-01-21T11:04:30+08:00","message":"UUID:2555_2555_nginx_22_1_192.168.20.16:61641-192.168.10.201:5443, Name:HTTP2Response, Type:4, Length:10573

header field ":status" = "200"
header field "server" = "nginx"

header field "x-content-type-options" = "nosniff"
```

Looking forward to your reply!

satisfaction_conditions: Stream ID information must be visible for each HTTP/2 frame in the output
Data frames must be displayed individually rather than concatenated
Frame boundaries must be clearly identifiable in the output
Original frame content must be preserved without modification

initial_question.title: -w保存为pcapng格式文件时显示 save 0 packets into pcapng file.
initial_question.body:
当我使用AVD模拟器的时候，使用最新的x86-64的ecapture，使用./ecapture tls能够很明显的看见抓的到包，但是当我./ecapture tls -w test.pcapng的时候，最后的输出是这样的：
tls_2022/12/08 10:00:48 TLS1_2_VERSION: save CLIENT_RANDOM 786cc517da567e2c224345d34cde9b1eff101a0b62a03784664a4efe0ef4479a to file success, 176 bytes
tls_2022/12/08 10:00:51 TLS1_2_VERSION: save CLIENT_RANDOM 42627d4f1ef118f4b3b471975f4f6f76d6545d137ffc39f1c741547f9e8ad6ef to file success, 176 bytes


^Ctls_2022/12/08 10:00:53 EBPFProbeOPENSSL      saving pcapng file /data/local/tmp/aito.pcapng
tls_2022/12/08 10:00:53 EBPFProbeOPENSSL         **save 0 packets into pcapng file.**关键就是这里，然后pcapng文件中什么都没有
tls_2022/12/08 10:00:53 EBPFProbeOPENSSL        close.
tls_2022/12/08 10:00:53 EBPFProbeOPENSSL        close.

satisfaction_conditions: Output file must be writable in the specified location
